alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 5:45AM EDT until May 05 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Androscoggin River Near Auburn affecting Androscoggin, Sagadahoc and Cumberland Counties. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Belknap and Merrimack Counties. Lamprey River Near Newmarket affecting Rockingham and Strafford Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Somerset and Kennebec Counties. Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Sagadahoc and Kennebec Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. For the Androscoggin River...including Gorham, Rumford, Auburn... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lamprey River...including Newmarket...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Suncook River at North Chichester. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Flooding occurs at several camp sites at the Lazy River Campground. At 9.0 feet, Flooding occurs at about 20 camp sites at the Lazy River Campground. Flooding also begins at the Epsom Valley Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 AM EDT Wednesday was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 5.6 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
